result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael William Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $680.62 payable to Pick N Save.  Joint and several with Catina Cook 13CM530.

Pay  DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.   Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to cae 13CF3414, but consecutive to any other  sentence the defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
No contact with the victims Sears and Pick N Save.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Complete any other programs the probation department deems appropriate.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael William Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael William Brown in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Michael William Brown in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Statements made by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS, concurrent to case# 13CF3414, but consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving, with credit for ZERO days time served.  
Court ordered 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 2 YEARS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims, Sears and Pick N Save.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Complete any other programs the Probation Department deems appropriate.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $680.62 payable to Pick N Save, joint and several with Catina Crook (13CM530).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Michael William Brown in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Michael William Brown in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Michael William Brown not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Defendant was not produced today; defendant had a scheduled video conference appearance for Waukesha County Court today.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-23-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
to Judge Donald; from the defendant - filed.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Michael William Brown not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant has pending misdemeanor cases before Judge McAdams' Court.
This court will accept the misdemeanor cases for a global resolution.
Parties request a plea and sentencing hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-18-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Catrina C and Pick n Save
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with drug testing.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael William Brown in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Michael William Brown in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02., due to a lower pending case. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
